sub_title: Contracts Management Specialist at Organisation for the Prohibition of Chemical Weapons  (OPCW) / MSc • CAM • BBA• MBA
summary:
An accomplished and highly driven Business Administration / Operations Professional, with 2 decades of progressive achievement across roles in Administrative, Finance, Human Resources, Procurement, Logistics, and Contracts Management. 

Beginning in Intern / Industrial Attachment roles with Ashanti Goldfields, Zimbabwe, Palms & Bonds, Botswana, and United Nations Children’s Fund, Harare Country Office; further working for a year as a Business Development Executive on behalf of AURCO [Internal Audit, Risk & Control Experts].

From 2007 Sipho joined PEN South Africa [Pretoria Evangelism & Nurture], as Administrative & Human Resources Manager - playing a key role in establishing relevant systems and streamlining organisation operations. In 2009, he joined the United Nations Population Fund - Africa, and sustained a decade+ in service to the organisation across various positions [Finance & Administrative Associate | Operations & Human Resources Analyst | Contracts Management Officer].

As a results-driven leader, with excellent communication and organisational skills, Sipho expertly maximises the efficiency and effectiveness of all areas under his control; maintaining a solid work ethic under substantial pressure and ‘shifting gears’ as needed, to take on additional / advanced responsibilities [responding to the needs of the workplace, stakeholder or sector].

awards.title: Career Highlights:
awards.description:
Established the first UNFPA Africa Regional Contracts Review Board in 2019; directing evaluation of compliance on all procurement initiatives and procedures undertaken by the various Regional and Country Offices in Africa [where valued at over US$ 100 000].

Appointed to a specially selected team of 8 UNFPA staff, mandated to develop UNFPA’s Corporate Global Human Resources Business Plan for 2010 to 2014.

Worked alongside the International Operations Manager to establish UNFPA’s Regional and Sub-Regional Offices in 2009.

Supporting institution of all premises, full local staffing, office and ICT services, and operational contracts required to effectively run the office.

Operation was successfully up and running within 3-months.

Further, coordinated the accreditation of up to 40 international staff and 22 national staff.

Established; Assets baseline to ensure optimal management of assets.

Accountability framework for all support staff [with clear roles and responsibilities].

Standard operating procedures for operations and administration.

Coached and trained newly recruited staff for both Regional and Sub-Regional Offices, further championing continuous development towards creating staff capability in systems implementation, and compliance with all established policies and procedures.

Developed a Regional Offices Budget and Operations Reporting Framework, that has subsequently been adopted across all Country Offices in the East and Southern African Regions.

Participated in extensive revision and development of new policies and procedures, responding to country specific needs; as well as the formulation of a new HR strategy [Member of various Working Committees].

While with PEN [Pretoria Evangelism & Nurture]; drafted the essential HR, Procurement, Logistics and Administrative Sections of the organisation’s Procedures and Policies Manual.

profile_positions.description:
Focal point for all contractual matters within GSS, championing sound management and compliance of all contracts managed by the GSS.

Establish and maintain work programmes and schedules for on-going and newly planned contracts; and coordinated all contractual aspects of procurement projects.

Support the development and implementation of operational plans for the Section, including standard operating procedures relating to contract compliance and performance management.

Compile contract compliance checklists and contributed towards creation of a systematic method to monitor contract performance.

Participate in contract risk assessment and creation of risk management plans / mitigating measures; further providing solutions to resolve vendor-related issues.

Liaise with other offices, departments and entities regarding the handling of claims, disputes and other contractual remedies.

Gave input into the planning and allocation of resources, as the focal person for Section related budgeting and forecasting.

Assist staff across all GSS Units in the management of various service and supply contracts, including planning and allocation of resources.

Supervise leases on all OPCW leased Properties; as well as related catering and cleaning services, and insurances.

Provide guidance to the Building Management Unit regarding management of maintenance services and supply contracts for various utilities; as well as management of any alterations and improvements to the technical systems and building services.

Oversee procurement processes, assisting with the evaluation of vendor proposals, and providing guidance during contract formulation, drafting and negotiation.
